context: For the VOCs, the seasonal trends were not clearly observed due to their high volatility and effect of temperature. The leachate samples for VOC analyses would be highly affected by the environmental conditions (i.e. temperature) and sample handling. The data collected after the modeling period (2007 and 2008) showed a good fits with the projected values for this period except for except ammonia and chlorobenzene. Time series model was used for forecasting and elimination of the seasonal effects from the data. Forecasting analyses were performed using the data collected until 2006. The recent data collected between 2007 and 2008 were used to compare with the model predictions.

llm_generation.summary: In this context, ammonia and chlorobenzene are both mentioned as volatile organic compounds (VOCs) analyzed in leachate samples. However, the discussion focuses on the modeling and forecasting of VOC data, indicating that both substances did not fit well with the projected values during the specified period. There is no direct interaction or relationship between ammonia and chlorobenzene discussed beyond their inclusion in the same analysis.
